item.title: My White Boss Talked About Race in America and This is What Happened
item.description:
My White Boss Talked About Race in America and This is What Happened

I am a Black woman. Not only that, I am a Black woman working in tech, one of the most homogeneous industries ever birthed. As a woman in tech, I account for 30% of the tech workforce. As a Black person in tech, I account for 5% of the tech workforce.

item.title: Bart Simpson Taught Me Everything I Need To Know About Human Empathy
item.description:
Bart Simpson Taught Me Everything I Need To Know About Human Empathy

A young mother, sitting at the park and typing into her smartphone instead of watching her toddler; a young child, throwing a screaming fit at the grocery store, that college student with the pink bejeweled iPhone case; what do all of these images provoke? Judgement.

item.title: A Gentle Introduction to the Basics of Machine Learning
item.description:
A Gentle Introduction to the Basics of Machine Learning

Machine Learning is one of the most important technologies nowadays. It is the key element that allows a computer to learn. It is in fact a subfield of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Right now AI is affecting all industries, from finance to medicine, from aerospace to e-commerce.

item.title: The Kids Are All Right: 5 Simple Ways to Instill an Entrepreneurial Mindset
item.description:
The Kids Are All Right: 5 Simple Ways to Instill an Entrepreneurial Mindset

Naturally, most kids are daring, adventurous, eager to learn, willing to take risks, fearless, and decisive. Most of these traits are equally found in most successful entrepreneurs. But, just like learning to tie their shoes laces, or to ride a bike, when it comes to nurturing your children's entrepreneurial spirit, they'll need still need guidance from you.

item.title: Originals
item.description:
Originals

I would recommend you these two books. I would recommend you these two books.

item.title: How Exercise Shapes You, Far Beyond the Gym
item.description:
How Exercise Shapes You, Far Beyond the Gym

When I first started training for marathons a little over ten years ago, my coach told me something I've never forgotten: that I would need to learn how to be comfortable with being uncomfortable. I didn't know it at the time, but that skill, cultivated through running, would help me as much, if not more, off the road as it would onit.

item.title: The Kids Are All Right: 5 Simple Ways to Instill an Entrepreneurial Mindset
item.description:
The Kids Are All Right: 5 Simple Ways to Instill an Entrepreneurial Mindset

Naturally, most kids are daring, adventurous, eager to learn, willing to take risks, fearless, and decisive. Most of these traits are equally found in most successful entrepreneurs. But, just like learning to tie their shoes laces, or to ride a bike, when it comes to nurturing your children's entrepreneurial spirit, they'll need still need guidance from you.

item.title: Lazy Leadership: Why I rarely go to the office, only see my team a couple times a week, and let other people make important decisions
item.description:
Lazy Leadership: Why I rarely go to the office, only see my team a couple times a week, and let other people make important decisions

Let's just get this out there: on paper, I'm a terrible CEO. I avoid going into the office, I only meet with my team a couple times a week, and I especially hate giving speeches, coming up with vision statements, leading meetings, and all the other CEO-y stuff you read about in HBR.
